div.p: This code system contains codes for documenting the attributes of the FHIR resource Validation to reflect the business process of validating information in a Healthcare Directory.
This code system http://hl7.org/fhir/ig/vhdir/CodeSystem/codesystem-validation defines the following codes:

tr.td: No validation needed/planned for this resource or element.
Validation only needed once after initial attestation
Validation is only needed after initial attestation. For elements that typically do not change such as 'medical school attended and graduation date'
Validation is needed after initial attestation and on a periodic basis
Validation is needed after initial attestation and on a periodic basis. E.g. elements that expire or may change such as licensure.
Indicates the element or resource has only been attested.
Indicates the element or resource has only been attested.
Indicates the element or resource has been successfully validated.
Indicates the element or resource has been successfully validated.
Indicates the element or resource is currently being validated.
Indicates the element or resource is currently being validated.
Indicates the element or resource has passed an expiration date and requires revalidation.
Indicates the element or resource has passed an expiration date and requires revalidation.
Indicates validation was attepted on an element or resource and that validation failed.
Indicates validation was attepted on an element or resource and that validation failed.
Indicates the element or resource is validated against a single source.
Indicates the element or resource may require validation against multiple sources, e.g. a practitioner participating in an insurance network.
Indicates the element or resource is validated for format, range, presence, or other similar properties.
Indicates the element or resource is validated against a value set.
Indicates the element or resource is validated against an external source.
Indicates the element or resource is validated by itself and is unrelated to other elements or resources.
Indicates the element or resource is validated by the existence or value of another related element or resource.
A failure that is likely relevant to local workflow environments, considered sufficient to suspend the resource/element and one or more action has been taken.
A failure that may be relevant to some local workflow environments, but in and of itself is not consider sufficient to suspend the resource/element. E.g. validating membership in an organization.
A failure that may be relevant to some local workflow environments and will be documented but not result in notification or publication of the error.
A failure that is unlikely to be relevant to any local workflow environment.
The resource or element is validated manually.
The resource or element is validated via an application programming interface (API).
Data is sent (i.e. pushed) from a source of valid data to the Healthcare Directory
The validation process is complete and a determination made that the the attested data is true and accurate.
The validation process is complete and a determination made that the the attested data is not true or accurate.
The validation process is complete and a determination could not be made that the the attested data is, or is not, true and accurate.
The primary source validation can be achieved via a push of data from the source of that information.
The primary source validation cannot be achieved via a push of data from the source of that information.
It is if undetermined if primary source validation can be achieved via a push of data from the source of that information.
The sender will send specific changes to the healthcare directory as determined by agreement.
The sender will send all changes to the healthcare directory.
The sender will only send changes they have determined to be significant.
Indicate the element or resource was owner
Indicates the element or resource was attested to by the individual who owned the data.
Indicates the element or resource was attested to by an individual who was designated to attest by the owner of the data.
Indicates the element or resource was attested to by a system (intermediary) that was designated to attest by the owner of the data.
Indicates the element or resource was attested to by an individual or system that was not deignated to attest by the owner of the data.
